articles.author: Kate Brady, Aaron Wiener
articles.title: German city evacuates 20,000 after unexploded World War II bombs are found - The Washington Post
articles.description: Authorities in Cologne said this was the largest evacuation of the city since World War II. Unexploded ordnance has commonly been found across Europe.
articles.content: BERLIN Some 20,500 people were being evacuated from the city of Cologne,in western Germany, as explosives experts prepared to defuse three unexploded World War II bombs found during construction work… [+2918 chars]
